item.title: Home Health Aides Fear They'll Lose Hard-Won Insurance Coverage
item.description: March 31, 2017 - Many health care aides were able to get insurance through the Affordable Care Act. But with the law's future uncertain, they don't know how their jobs or their doctor bills will be affected.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 31, 2017 - Many health care aides were able to get insurance through the Affordable Care Act. But with the law's future uncertain, they don't know how their jobs or their doctor bills will be affected. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/31/522082858/home-health-aides-fear-theyll-lose-hard-won-insurance-coverage

item.title: Why The Newly Proposed Sepsis Treatment Needs More Study
item.description: March 30, 2017 - The bodywide inflammation known as sepsis kills about 300,000 people in U.S. hospitals each year. Promising treatments have come and gone, warn skeptical doctors, who call for rigorous research.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - The bodywide inflammation known as sepsis kills about 300,000 people in U.S. hospitals each year. Promising treatments have come and gone, warn skeptical doctors, who call for rigorous research. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/30/521918863/why-the-newly-proposed-sepsis-treatment-needs-more-study

item.title: In California, Health Care Marketplace Appears To Be Thriving
item.description: March 30, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Peter Lee, executive director of Covered California, about how state health care exchanges will work now that the AHCA has failed in Congress.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Peter Lee, executive director of Covered California, about how state health care exchanges will work now that the AHCA has failed in Congress. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/30/522091627/in-california-health-care-marketplace-appears-to-be-thriving

item.title: In Sweden, Hundreds Of Refugee Children Gave Up On Life
item.description: March 30, 2017 - An article in this week's New Yorker writes about youngsters who fell into a coma-like state in reaction to the news that their family may be deported. We interview the author.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - An article in this week's New Yorker writes about youngsters who fell into a coma-like state in reaction to the news that their family may be deported. We interview the author. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/30/521958505/only-in-sweden-hundreds-of-refugee-children-gave-up-on-life

item.title: Why Didn't Zika Cause A Surge In Microcephaly In 2016?
item.description: March 30, 2017 - Scientists predicted that more than 1,000 babies would be born with the birth defect in Brazil last year. That never happened. Why?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - Scientists predicted that more than 1,000 babies would be born with the birth defect in Brazil last year. That never happened. Why? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/30/521925733/why-didnt-zika-cause-a-surge-in-microcephaly-in-2016

item.title: A Tiny Spot In Mouse Brains May Explain How Breathing Calms The Mind
item.description: March 30, 2017 - A cluster of neurons connects breathing and emotion centers in mouse brains, researchers say. If this turns out to be true in humans, it could explain how controlled breathing calms the mind.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - A cluster of neurons connects breathing and emotion centers in mouse brains, researchers say. If this turns out to be true in humans, it could explain how controlled breathing calms the mind. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/30/522033368/a-tiny-spot-in-mouse-brains-may-explain-how-breathing-calms-the-mind

item.title: Lonely People Report More Severe Cold Symptoms, Study Finds
item.description: March 30, 2017 - The study builds on previous evidence linking loneliness to more serious health problems, but the findings do not link the sheer size of a person's social network to cold symptom severity.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - The study builds on previous evidence linking loneliness to more serious health problems, but the findings do not link the sheer size of a person's social network to cold symptom severity. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/30/521927344/lonely-people-report-more-severe-cold-symptoms-study-finds

item.title: EPA Says It Will Allow Continued Sale Of Controversial Pesticide
item.description: March 30, 2017 - The EPA is not going ahead with a proposed ban on a pesticide called chlorpyrifos, saying there's still scientific uncertainty over its safety. Environmental groups say it can harm young children.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - The EPA is not going ahead with a proposed ban on a pesticide called chlorpyrifos, saying there's still scientific uncertainty over its safety. Environmental groups say it can harm young children. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/30/522015717/epa-says-it-will-allow-continued-sale-of-controversial-pesticide

item.title: Fewer Zika-Linked Birth Defects Than Expected
item.description: March 30, 2017 - Scientists expected a surge of severe birth defects in Brazil because of the Zika outbreak. But that didn't happen last year. Researchers are re-examining the link between Zika and birth defects.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - Scientists expected a surge of severe birth defects in Brazil because of the Zika outbreak. But that didn't happen last year. Researchers are re-examining the link between Zika and birth defects. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/30/522015647/fewer-zika-linked-birth-defects-than-expected

item.title: 'The VA Is On A Path Toward Recovery,' Secretary Of Veterans Affairs Says
item.description: March 30, 2017 - Secretary of Veterans Affairs David Shulkin says preventing suicide among military veterans is his "number one clinical priority," and that he is working to fill some 45,000 open jobs in the agency.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - Secretary of Veterans Affairs David Shulkin says preventing suicide among military veterans is his "number one clinical priority," and that he is working to fill some 45,000 open jobs in the agency. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/30/521937557/the-va-is-on-a-path-toward-recovery-secretary-of-veterans-affairs-says

item.title: Democratic Senator Urges Trump To 'Do More Than Talk' On Opioid Crisis
item.description: March 29, 2017 - Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire addressed the opioid problem in her state for several years as governor. NPR's Kelly McEvers talks with Hassan about President Trump's opioid plans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire addressed the opioid problem in her state for several years as governor. NPR's Kelly McEvers talks with Hassan about President Trump's opioid plans. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/29/521954068/democratic-senator-urges-trump-to-do-more-than-talk-on-opioid-crisis

item.title: Missouri Rejects Federal Money In Order To Set Up Its Own Abortion Restrictions
item.description: March 29, 2017 - Abortion is already heavily restricted in Missouri, but now the state is cutting more funding to organizations that provide abortions, even though it means rejecting millions of dollars from the feds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - Abortion is already heavily restricted in Missouri, but now the state is cutting more funding to organizations that provide abortions, even though it means rejecting millions of dollars from the feds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/29/521248820/missouri-rejects-federal-money-in-order-to-set-up-its-own-abortion-restrictions

item.title: Trump Holds 'Listening Session' On Opioid Addiction
item.description: March 29, 2017 - President Trump held a "listening session" on opioid addiction Wednesday, the beginning of what the White House says will be its effort to address a problem that resonated on the campaign trail.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - President Trump held a "listening session" on opioid addiction Wednesday, the beginning of what the White House says will be its effort to address a problem that resonated on the campaign trail. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/29/521954061/trump-holds-listening-session-on-opioid-addiction

item.title: EPA Decides Not To Ban A Pesticide, Despite Its Own Evidence Of Risk
item.description: March 29, 2017 - New EPA administrator Scott Pruitt has decided not to ban chlorpyrifos, a pesticide widely used on produce. That's despite evidence previously compiled by EPA showing it could pose risks to consumers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - New EPA administrator Scott Pruitt has decided not to ban chlorpyrifos, a pesticide widely used on produce. That's despite evidence previously compiled by EPA showing it could pose risks to consumers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/29/521898976/will-the-epa-reject-a-pesticide-or-its-own-scientific-evidence

item.title: 6 Changes The Trump Administration Can Still Make To Obamacare
item.description: March 29, 2017 - The Republican overhaul bill died, but the health care drama continues. There are lots of ways the administration can change the Affordable Care Act, without congressional approval.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - The Republican overhaul bill died, but the health care drama continues. There are lots of ways the administration can change the Affordable Care Act, without congressional approval. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/29/521713002/6-changes-the-trump-administration-can-still-make-to-obamacare
